newsitem.title: UK: Amoco makes oil discovery in central N.Sea.
newsitem.headline: Amoco makes oil discovery in central N.Sea.

text.p: Amoco Corp has discovered oil in the central Graben area of the North Sea, the company said in a statement on Thursday.
According to the statement, an exploration well in block 22/18-6 -- some 130 miles east of Aberdeen -- found "volatile oil" which is indicative of crude oil with a high natural gas content.
The well flowed oil at an average of 3,500 barrels per day and gas at an average 10.5 million cubic feet per day.
Amoco planned to submit its development plan to Britain's Department of Trade and Industry in the second half of 1997 with the goal of starting up production in 1998, the statement said.
The field is situated less than two miles from Amoco's existing Arbroath oilfield which is part of the Montrose/Arbroath/Arkwright complex.

"Given the proximity of the discovery to out Montrose and Arbroath platforms, we will be looking at ways to utilise these facilities and fast track development," Todd Rounding, Amoco's Central Graben Exploration Manager said.
Amoco was considering the possibility of a subsea development tied to the existing Montrose and Arbroath platforms, the statement said.
